title: tread93
author: tread93
content: Check it out, its official as of yesterday 10/10/23!https://www.ngccoin.com/news/article/12210/Well worth the read, finally announcing! This is huge for our niche, folks!

comments.author: krogothmanhattan
comments.body: Wow.....250 cas coins....in my dreams!Â  The Otoh collection...I wonder how many more of these in his other collection Â  Â Thanks for sharing this with us...should be interesting!

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: These coins will probably be a great way for folks who donâ€™t want to deal with software or trusting exchanges but want to get their hands on some Bitcoin to hold. I imagine during the next bull run these could get peeled and still have massive profits. For anyone with some USD saved that has wanted a Casascius coin but didnâ€™t want to trust members of this community, this is the best opportunity you will probably ever get. As for OTOH, I suspect at some point you get enough wealth that owning things like this is more of a pain in the ass than anything else.

comments.author: Box Guy
comments.body: Quite impressive collectionâ€¦well played Otoh, well played.

comments.author: tread93
comments.body: Quote from: krogothmanhattan on October 11, 2023, 08:23:46 PM Â Wow.....250 cas coins....in my dreams! Â The Otoh collection...I wonder how many more of these in his other collection Â Â  Thanks for sharing this with us...should be interesting!Absolutely! I know the announcement has been due for a while now, and I didn't see any thread with the official announcement so I took the liberty of sharing with the group. I am very pleased with NGC finally grading crypto! Now if they could just make the service public on all other outlets, NGC IG, Emails, Website, etc. I have to hand it to Otoh, like 250 Cass coins has to be just a small fraction of his collection. Definitely well played!! Its always good to cash out at some point in this case he has done us a huge favor getting with NGC who has been so stubborn to grade these coins in this space for so long. Otoh has done this at such a great time and for the good of the community, I hope he makes a killing on this!

comments.author: 2stout
comments.body: Perhaps I misread the article but my takeaway is that they did not explicitly state whether this was a one off, are they only grading casascius, and/or are they grading other cryptos. Â Therefore, my expectations are tempered until they make a more specific announcement(s), but I do agree this is a good thing.

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: iirc someone did post about the Otoh collection going up - had to be somewhere as I had seen the link a few weeks back.Quote from: 2stout on October 11, 2023, 09:46:04 PMPerhaps I misread the article but my takeaway is that they did not explicitly state whether this was a one off, are they only grading casascius, and/or are they grading other cryptos. Â Therefore, my expectations are tempered until they make a more specific announcement(s), but I do agree this is a good thing.NGC does do grading of crypto coins - I have one or two that were graded by NGC - got them a few months back.how many different ones I do not know though.

comments.author: BTCOVERFIATS
comments.body: Wait were all 250 coins submitted purely from Otoh?

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: BTCOVERFIATS on October 11, 2023, 10:41:07 PMWait were all 250 coins submitted purely from Otoh?Appears that way. Quite a flood at once IMO.

comments.author: Hox
comments.body: Very cool. Especially since they're labeled "The Otoh Collection". I expect these will go for relatively high premiums.Congrats Otoh!

comments.author: BTCOVERFIATS
comments.body: Does anyone know if they accept Bitcoin as payment? I can't find any information on the website

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: BTCOVERFIATS on October 11, 2023, 10:48:58 PMDoes anyone know if they accept Bitcoin as payment? I can't find any information on the website I don't think so... Below are some common answers to questions on the topic you selected:What are your payment options?https://fineart.ha.com/c/contact-us.zx?ref=&topicId=10#answerEdit this site seems pretty high end but must deal with all sorts of scams judging by the "Email me!" pages lol... IDK. Never been a mainstream online auction house-follower either, so there is that as well. Now that I look deeper, I may contact them about a rare 1969 set of sterling dinnerware that my parents received at their wedding and was never used or opened, so in great shape box and all. They seem to deal with all sorts of different stuffs.... I'll let ya know!

comments.author: BTCOVERFIATS
comments.body: Quote from: owlcatz on October 11, 2023, 10:53:23 PMQuote from: BTCOVERFIATS on October 11, 2023, 10:48:58 PMDoes anyone know if they accept Bitcoin as payment? I can't find any information on the website I don't think so... Below are some common answers to questions on the topic you selected:What are your payment options?https://fineart.ha.com/c/contact-us.zx?ref=&topicId=10#answerHold up I just found it..."Heritage offers extended payment plan options up to six months to qualified, pre-approved clients on select items. Please email eppgroup@HA.com or call Client Services for more information. We also accept Bitcoin and Ethereum on invoices over $5,000 subject to approval. Please email Bid@HA.com or call Client Services for details."but what also sucks is this..."A deposit of $5,000 or more is necessary in order to participate in this auction. Heritage reserves the right to determine the amount of deposit to be submitted"

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: BTCOVERFIATS on October 11, 2023, 10:58:02 PMHold up I just found it..."Heritage offers extended payment plan options up to six months to qualified, pre-approved clients on select items. Please email eppgroup@HA.com or call Client Services for more information. We also accept Bitcoin and Ethereum on invoices over $5,000 subject to approval. Please email Bid@HA.com or call Client Services for details."but what also sucks is this..."A deposit of $5,000 or more is necessary in order to participate in this auction. Heritage reserves the right to determine the amount of deposit to be submitted"Ah.. Nice find! I thought it might be possible via a contact or the right channel, but I have no idea really... That is a bit much, but I guess it's understandable considering the risk factors. Then again, Id' probably need a deposit of that much in some $ or proof thereof even to participate anyhow, amirite?

comments.author: rsincognito
comments.body: I spoke to them extensively on the phone today, they donâ€™t usually do the $5000 deposit thing, but because of the value of each coin thatâ€™s what you got a pay to play. I have the credit app and Iâ€™m filling it out tomorrow to submit it, when I find out the terms Iâ€™ll let everybody know on the site. Being able to pay in bitcoin would be a major plus.

comments.author: raritycheck
comments.body: Wow! This is a huge moment in crypto collectibles!

comments.author: rsincognito
comments.body: Quote from: rsincognito on October 12, 2023, 01:39:53 AMI spoke to them extensively on the phone today, they donâ€™t usually do the $5000 deposit thing, but because of the value of each coin thatâ€™s what you got a pay to play. I have the credit app and Iâ€™m filling it out tomorrow to submit it, when I find out the terms Iâ€™ll let everybody know on the site. Being able to pay in bitcoin would be a major plus. Currently looking at the credit app and the requirements and it is borderline an "anal probe" about 2 feet inside. lol. along with $5k deposit bank wire they want a letter signed by bank like a power of attorneyÂ  that allows the bank to release all banking account info showing current balances and such to the auction house. along with a resellers tax ID and a personal guarantee. As a long time business owner the only time I have seen more credit verification needed from myself was when I was trying to get a loan on a commercial piece of property, its almost that deep of a dive. I will continue to keep you all posted on my experience if you like.
